decks.notes: This deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and overwhelming the opponent with their large bodies and disruptive abilities. By utilizing mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith, the deck aims to play its threats ahead of curve and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells makes this deck a formidable force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches, aiming to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to create early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By combining fast threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent with disruption from cards like Thoughtseize and Daze, the deck aims to control the game tempo and maintain a strong board presence. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower provide additional value and flexibility in dealing with threats. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan while also providing necessary fixing for the deck's color requirements.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to control the board and protect its threats. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Wan Shi Tong, Librarian to close out the game quickly. By combining disruption with aggression, this deck aims to quickly outpace and overwhelm the opponent before they can recover. With a solid mix of control elements and aggressive threats, this deck is well-positioned to take down opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key combo pieces using self-mill and fast mana ramp like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual. By sacrificing creatures and casting ritual spells, the deck aims to put Thassa's Oracle or Bridge from Below in play to win the game on the spot. It disrupts the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy, and uses reanimation spells like Reanimate to bring back key pieces if needed. The deck aims to execute its game plan as quickly and efficiently as possible to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on using the powerful combo of Doomsday to set up a winning scenario by stacking the top of your library with specific cards, then drawing into Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck includes ways to quickly dig through your library, protect your combo pieces with countermagic, and generate the necessary mana to execute the combo. The inclusion of various cantrips and tutors allows for consistency in setting up the Doomsday win condition, making the deck a potent force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The primary strategy of this deck focuses on swiftly deploying powerful creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's mana development while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers. The combination of quick mana acceleration, disruptive elements, and strong creatures allows the deck to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo throughout the game, ultimately leading to a decisive victory.

The deck aims to quickly win the game by milling the entire deck into the graveyard and then using a combination of cards like Dread Return, Reanimate, and Thassa's Oracle to secure the victory. It utilizes a variety of fast mana sources and combo pieces to execute the strategy as efficiently as possible. The deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of spells and creatures, often achieving victory in just a few turns. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces and execute the combo before the opponent can mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty, Atraxa, and Griselbrand using spells like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Shallow Grave. The deck also includes cards like Cabal Therapy and Collective Brutality to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect your own combo. The deck aims to win by overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures early in the game and controlling the board with discard spells. The mana base is designed to support the deck's black-heavy color requirements for its spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and disruption, while cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize help control the board. The deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot with tempo plays like Daze and Brazen Borrower, while also having the ability to close out the game quickly with powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game, utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Exploration to ramp up and take advantage of powerful land synergies. Field of the Dead and Dark Depths provide token generation and threats, while Maze of Ith and Wasteland disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes ways to recycle lands from the graveyard with Life from the Loam and card draw with Mulch and Winding Way. The goal is to outvalue the opponent through land-based control and win the game with efficient land combinations.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies by utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Amped Raptor to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has ways to remove threats with Swords to Plowshares while also having ways to close out the game with cards like Goblin Bombardment. The mana base is carefully constructed to provide the necessary colors for the deck to function smoothly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's entire deck in one turn. It uses cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to facilitate getting the combo pieces onto the battlefield quickly. Additionally, cards like Pyroblast and Lightning Bolt offer control options while Urza's Saga and Karn, the Great Creator help to find key artifacts. The deck aims to lock down the opponent with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and disrupt their game plan with disruptive spells, eventually winning through the combo.

The deck focuses on using Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to rapidly assemble the combo of Painter's Servant with Grindstone to mill the opponent's deck. It also utilizes powerful disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect the combo and control the opponent's spells. The deck includes additional versatile cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate its game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Urza's Saga provides card advantage and toolbox options to further strengthen the deck's strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and disruptive cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes Stoneforge Mystic to efficiently search for equipment cards like Batterskull and Meteor Sword to provide additional threats and value. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd offer card advantage and flexibility in dealing with various threats. Murktide Regent and Quantum Riddler serve as win conditions and additional pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy and provide consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this Control - Stoneblade deck is to use a combination of powerful control spells like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Stifle alongside efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Snapcaster Mage to manipulate the battlefield and outvalue opponents. The deck also includes cards like Back to Basics and Prismatic Ending to disrupt opponents' game plans and maintain a strong board presence. By controlling the pace of the game and generating incremental advantages, the deck aims to establish a dominant position and close out the game efficiently.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive play, utilizing low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and control the game. Using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to deal damage and remove opposing threats, this deck aims to maintain board presence and tempo advantage to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.
